subject: RE: [junit] A Growing Problem
msgSnippet: If you really had to go this route, look at JFunc ... However, I don t trust my ability to fix more than one thing at once
messageBody:
If you really had to go this route, look at JFunc
<http://jfunc.sourceforge.net/>...

However, I don't trust my ability to "fix" more than one thing at once
anyway, and so I would stay away from this. My experience with folks
who think they can do this has been that they spend more time fixing
the errors they introduced by trying to do batch bug fixing than fixing
one at a time and moving on to the next. (sorry for the run-on
sentence)

=jason

On Wed, 21 Aug 2002 10:00:34 -0400, "Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-MBC)"
<timothy.j.stevens@...> said:
> This message only has an HTML part -- this is a text generated
> representation
>
>
> >And that JUnit fail after one test fails, so what? You want all
> tests to
> >pass so if one fails, find it, fix your code, and go again.
> This can be a big problem in large systems that take minutes
> (or
> longer) to
> compile and test. It's nice to get a complete list of failures so
> that
> you
> can attempt to fix as many as possible before having to dive into
> the
> build
> process again...
> -tim
